title: 91. Can Selling Beer Cut Down on Public Drunkenness?
description: Binge drinking is a big problem at college football games. Oliver Luck -- father of No. 1 NFL pick Andrew, and the athletic director at West Virginia University -- had an unusual idea to help solve it.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
content:encoded: Binge drinking is a big problem at college football games. Oliver Luck -- father of No. 1 NFL pick Andrew, and the athletic director at West Virginia University -- had an unusual idea to help solve it.
